clinical_summary: On 2025-03-01 laboratory testing showed markedly elevated SGOT (162 U/L) and total bilirubin (9.4 mg/dL) accompanied by thrombocytopenia (platelet count 95,000 /ÂµL), indicating abnormal liver function and low platelet count.

differential_diagnoses.name: Acute hepatic injury (e.g., viral hepatitis or drug-induced liver injury)
differential_diagnoses.justification: Elevated SGOT and total bilirubin suggest significant liver cell injury.

differential_diagnoses.name: Acute cholestatic liver disease
differential_diagnoses.justification: High total bilirubin with liver enzyme elevation may reflect impaired bile flow.

differential_diagnoses.name: Hepatocellular failure with associated thrombocytopenia
differential_diagnoses.justification: Combined liver enzyme and bilirubin rise together with low platelet count can occur in severe liver dysfunction.
